title: Santa Draven is a 975 skin at best
body:
I'm not seeing how this skin prices up to 1350. Riot's skin tier pricing guide describes 975 skins as:

"Features: new model, new texture, new splash image.
Sometimes includes: new animations, visual effects, and sounds where appropriate for the skin's theme.
Examples: Haunted Maokai, Jade Dragon Wukong."

How is Haunted Maokai is a 975 but this skin is 1350? The Jinx and Poppy skins have a lot more unique particle effects so I suppose you can justify their prices, but the Draven one is way more simple than they are. Santa Draven doesn't even have a homeguard animation while the other 2 do. So less overall particles and animations, and no new VO or voice processing, just some sparkly chime sounds. Not worth 1350 if you ask me.

Well not really just the sound effect.  As you can see from their own [pricing guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752874-Guide-to-Skin-Price-Tiers)

975 Skins
Features: new model, new texture, new splash image.
Sometimes includes: new animations, visual effects, and sounds where appropriate for the skin's theme.
Examples: Haunted Maokai, Jade Dragon Wukong.

1350 RP - Epic skins
Features: new model, new texture, new splash image, new animations, new visual effects, new sounds.
Sometimes includes: processed voice overs.
Examples: Blackthorn Morgana, Arcade Sona.

A 975 just has a new model/texture and splash.  Where the 1350s are supposed to have the new model/texture, splash along with animations (can be a recall, basic attacks, ect) and new visuals and sounds.  So there is a little more that is meant to go into the 1350s however a lot of the time they don't actually do that.  Like when they pushed the SKT skins out, they didn't originally have new SFXs until the community complained enough that Riot updated them for the next patch.  They did however have everything else that they said they'd have.

The ultimate skins on the other hand, are basically a new champion. It does take them anywhere from 6 to 8 months (sometimes more) as they've got multiple models, textures, sfxs, all new animations, voice over.  So that's got a lot more work put into it then their general skins.

> The ultimate skins on the other hand, are basically a new champion. It does take them anywhere from 6 to 8 months (sometimes more) as they've got multiple models, textures, sfxs, all new animations, voice over.

I really really doubt that it takes 6 to 8 months to make ultimate skins with decent work ethic, but I'm not going to argue over it. As for the rest of what you wrote Riot has used one piece of the 1350 tier 'features' or the 'sometimes includes' 975 tier to justify pricing at 1350 regardless of the overall skin.
